item.title: Cloud Imperium Games Lets Go Some Staff Following Citizencon
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/cloud-imperium-games-layoffs-report/

Following a hectic period before Citizencon, during which staff were mandated to work 7-day work weeks, Cloud Imperium Games have just reportedly laid off some of its staff.

The information comes from an ex-CIG employee, who took to X (formerly Twitter) to say that their former employer “is letting a lot of staff go over the last two days with zero compensation right after working them to the bone without even much as a thanks,” and that a “formal announcement” should be “soon.”

Speaking with our own sources, we can confirm that Cloud Imperium Games has been letting some of its staff go these past couple of days, but we’re currently unable to verify the extent of the layoffs. At the time of writing, several sources said the layoffs have mainly affected the studio’s QA department and that the number of those laid off isn’t as large as initially made out to be, with one source estimating around a dozen currently affected (around 1% of its total workforce).

That being said, it’s still early days fairly early days yet, and Cloud Imperium Games has a history of laying off its staff over an extended period. Earlier this year, CIG quietly laid off an estimated 100 or so staff members at its Austin and LA offices which took weeks and even making affected employees sign NDAs to prevent them from talking about being laid off.

Cloud Imperium Games has yet to make an internal or public announcement to its staff on the layoffs and any possible restructuring.

We will update this article as we hear more.

Both current and former employees of Cloud Imperium Games can contact me securely and anonymously at [email protected] as I continue to investigate the company’s issues.

item.title: Do we Know When Doctor Doom is Coming to Marvel Rivals?
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/do-we-know-when-doctor-doom-is-coming-to-marvel-rivals/

Victor von Doom is just as menacing as his name suggests, and the villain—sometimes anti-hero—is a natural fit for Marvel Rivals. We already know the imperious presence of the doctor is confirmed, so let’s check out the latest on his arrival and see if he needs an appointment.

Marvel Rivals has a blockbuster, star-studded cast of characters befitting of a Marvel shooter. Meaning, that it makes sense to have (arguably) one of the most influential and memorable characters in the biggest attempt to date to bring the epic universe to games.

It’s no secret Doctor Doom is coming to Marvel Rivals, that much is certain. However, a lot of confusion is directed toward his potential debut—let’s take a look.

When is Doctor Doom coming to Marvel Rivals?

Neither NetEase nor Marvel has given an official launch date for Doctor Doom in Marvel Rivals—and there aren’t even any leaks to give us a glimmer of hope.

The lack of a Doctor Doom announcement is bizarre given the character’s eponymous trailer back on July 26: “Marvel Rivals | Cinematic Trailer | No One Rivals Doom.” While the majority of the trailer features an array of the Rivals stars fighting each other, the main focus is on Doctor Doom.

Curiously, he doesn’t feature on the Marvel Rivals hero page—despite his trailer—and if he doesn’t appear at launch, I’d expect him to be the focal point of at least one of the first two seasons.

If anything spells bad news, it’s two Doctor Dooms, and yet we’re here unable to verify the launch date of one—keep checking back as we wait for official confirmation from either developer or publisher on the character’s Marvel Rivals launch.

Who is Doctor Doom in Marvel Rivals?

Doctor Doom’s origin story is as sinister and foreboding as any: His mother was taken by Mephisto, and his father succumbed to death as an indirect effect of someone else’s actions. Cue the warpath of the vicious Victor von Doom. His brilliant use of magic and a mind for inventing and creation makes Doctor Doom one of the most-feared villains in Marvel—and history, to be honest.

He’s a genius, and Fantastic Four lovers will be intimately acquainted with Victor as they regularly clash. Hardened fans will debate for weeks on end who the greatest supervillain in the Marvel universe is; however, you only need to check different ranking lists to see Doom’s name appear at the top—in many cases the top spot.

Do you think Doctor Doom is the greatest Marvel villain ever? Or does someone else breed evil that tiny bit better? While you deliberate on this, be sure to read up on the hero shooter’s maps and modes, as well as the live-service title’s money laundering controversy.

item.title: Tencent Announces A Blatant Horizon Zero Dawn Knockoff Called ‘Light of Motiram’
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/light-of-motriam/

Tencent have announced with developer Polaris Quest that it will be releasing a new game called ‘Light of Motiram’ for PC which looks awfully like Horizon Zero Dawn.

The announcement came yesterday (first spotted by Gematsu), revealing that the game will launch for PC on Steam and the Epic Games Store, but the publisher did not give an official release date.

The game has already been ripped apart on social media for being a fairly blatant Horizon Zero Dawn ripoff, but we’ve attached some images below to make up your own minds.

The summary of the Light of Motiram reads,

A Mechanimal-Ruled Open World

“Earth and human civilization as we once knew it are gone. Across untamed wilderness, giant mechanical beasts roam freely, while humanity struggles to rebuild from the dawn of a new primitive era.

Journey from lush tropical rainforests to barren desert landscapes and snow-capped mountain peaks— as you discover unique Mechanimals and mysterious ruins in different regions, gradually uncovering the secrets of MOTIRAM.

Survive in the Wilderness

In this mechanical wilderness where civilization is a distant memory, primal cultures, extreme weather, and lurking Mechanimals will constantly test your survival skills. Make smart use of everything around you to stay alive and face off against formidable bosses, every step is fraught with danger and requires courage. Only by overcoming the challenges of survival can you carve out a place for yourself in this unforgiving land.

Realistic Physics-Based Building

Unleash your creativity with a freeform building system powered by realistic physics simulation. Construct a fortified stronghold or a cleverly designed shelter, every beam and brick is subject to real-world physical forces, ensuring that your structures are both visually stunning and able to withstand environmental challenges. Let your imagination run wild as you explore the endless possibilities of architecture.

Precise Combat Epic Boss Fights

Dodge, block, and counterattack with precise timing and execution. Sharpen your battle skills in life-or-death situations, deftly weaving through enemy assaults, dodging deadly blows, and seizing opportunities to counterattack. Don’t forget to coordinate with your Mechanimal partners—choosing the right companion can make your combat twice as effective.

Journey with Mechanimals at Your Side

Over 100 customizable Mechanimals await your taming and training. Whether you need combat support or a boost to production, each Mechanimal possesses unique abilities and growth potential. Through personalized customization, you can give them exclusive battle modes and production traits, transforming them into your most powerful allies.

Seamless Co-op & Cross-Play

Team up with up to 10 players to tackle daunting challenges together. No matter where you are, embark on adventures with your friends anytime and enjoy a seamless gaming experience. From hunting mechanical beasts, gathering resources to construction projects, progress never stops.
